hook.text: Major depression is the condition most people mean when they say depression.

buildup.text: It involves at least two weeks of deep sadness or loss of interest in nearly everything.

discovery.text: Episodes can last months and may recur multiple times across a lifetime.

twist.text: After one episode, the risk of a second jumps to 50 percent.

climax.text: Without treatment, episodes tend to grow longer and closer together over time.

punchline.text: The first episode opens a door that's hard to close.

quiz.question: After one depressive episode, what is the recurrence risk?
